argument.name: gmt_time
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. If flag is .T., then the time is returned as GMT.

page.discussion: NOW() returns the current date and time, correct to the millisecond, in the Time data type. Contrast this with the TIME() function which returns the result as a character string. The TIME() function does not return milliseconds.

section.description: The following Xbasic sequence can be typed in the Interactive window.
section.example: dim t1 as T dim t2 as T t1 = now() t2 = now() ? t2-t1 = 5.440000 dim t3 as T t3 = time() ERROR: variable type mismatch (error because time() returns a character value)
